element.name: Howth Cliff Walk - Piper's Gut by Bootle, Traditional Cache (2/3.5)
element.description: The second of 6 caches along the Howth Cliff Walk.
element.long-description:
The Howth Cliff Walk offers the walker a fine, varied walk around an open hillside and the Howth cliffs, with the guarantee of plentiful bird life, excellent sea views and colourful wild flowers.
The walk can be commenced at many different places along the route, with many easy access points from various car parks that are conveniently located close to the path. This caching trail commences at the car park 1km to the east of the village (N53 23.137 W6 03.048) and moves slowly south, then west, but can also be undertaken in a reverse order.
While the main walk is generally not very steep, a couple of caches may require some scrambling up brief stretches of steep terrain. As always in Ireland it is advised to bring along good waterproof clothing for the inevitable shower. Sturdy footware is also a must. If you wish to undertake the entire walk in one go it makes sense to bring a packed lunch and plenty of liquids, as the full journey may take in the region of 4-5 hours.
The Piper's Gut cache requires a scramble upwards from the cliff path, so care is required when heading up or down to the cache. The cache location should offer you a peaceful location to rest your bones! There is a clear, but steep path to the cache starting to the right of the sign post. The cache is a small regular cache. Happy caching!
element.additional-waypoints:
PI15N2Q - pipway
N 53째 22.535 W 006째 02.827
head up the trail from this point
element.encoded-hints: Obvious group of rocks surrounded by vegetation

ul.li:
2010-05-27T19:00:00Z : Found it by mkfezz
After a delicious supper of fish and chips in Howth we spent some time walking on the cliff walks. It was an absolutely beautiful evening. Thanks for bringing us to this spot. TNLN SL.

2010-05-25T19:00:00Z : Found it by schnuckel1
After the visit of the harbour we made a trip around Howth. From the cache we enjoyed the scenic view on the irish see. Logged at 13:02
IN: - OUT: Coin
TFTC schnuckel1 from Germany [# 778]

2010-05-09T19:00:00Z : Found it by Suburban cowboy
What a spectacular wiev [:)] TFTC Suburban cowboy Sweden

2010-05-08T19:00:00Z : Found it by Thinas
Found after some minutes of searching. Thanks for the cache. Greeting from Sweden.

2010-04-16T19:00:00Z : Found it by Fitzet
Came at this from above and found it with no difficulty at all. It was a beautiful night and we enjoyed a gorgeous sunset which we liked to think was caused by the icelandic volcanic ash.
Took: Wooden Geocoin, stretchy man Left: Groundspeak Lackeys Geocoin, stretchy man!
SL TFTC

2008-02-16T20:00:00Z : Found it by Kersti.com
Found with Christian, well, to tell the truth he ended up doing the actual find as my fear of heights got too much for me while scrambling up the (vertical - I swear) hillside...

wpt.desc: Howth Cliff Walk - Piper's Gut by Bootle, Traditional Cache (2/3.5)

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Howth Cliff Walk - Piper's Gut
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:short_description: The second of 6 caches along the Howth Cliff Walk.
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
The Howth Cliff Walk offers the walker a fine, varied walk around an open hillside and the Howth cliffs, with the guarantee of plentiful bird life, excellent sea views and colourful wild flowers.

The cache location should offer you a peaceful location to rest your bones! There is a clear, but steep path to the cache starting to the right of the sign post. The cache is a small regular cache. Happy caching!
